  • Constructor Details

    • BaseAutoBuilder

      protected BaseAutoBuilder(Supplier<edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d> poseSupplier, Consumer<edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d> resetPose, Map<String,edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command> eventMap, BaseAutoBuilder.DrivetrainType drivetrainType, boolean useAllianceColor)
      Construct a BaseAutoBuilder
      Parameters:
      poseSupplier - A function that supplies the robot pose - use one of the odometry classes to provide this.
      resetPose - A consumer that accepts a Pose2d to reset robot odometry. This will typically be called once ath the beginning of an auto.
      eventMap - Event map for triggering events at markers
      drivetrainType - Type of drivetrain the autobuilder is building for
      useAllianceColor - Should the path states be automatically transformed based on alliance color? In order for this to work properly, you MUST create your path on the blue side of the field.

    • BaseAutoBuilder

      protected BaseAutoBuilder(Supplier<edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d> poseSupplier, Map<String,edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command> eventMap, BaseAutoBuilder.DrivetrainType drivetrainType, boolean useAllianceColor)
      Construct a BaseAutoBuilder
      Parameters:
      poseSupplier - A function that supplies the robot pose - use one of the odometry classes to provide this.
      eventMap - Event map for triggering events at markers
      drivetrainType - Type of drivetrain the autobuilder is building for
      useAllianceColor - Should the path states be automatically transformed based on alliance color? In order for this to work properly, you MUST create your path on the blue side of the field.

  • Method Details

    • followPath

      public abstract edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandBase followPath(PathPlannerTrajectory trajectory)
      Create a path following command for a given trajectory. This will not trigger any events while path following.

      Override this to create auto builders for your custom path following commands.

      Parameters:
      trajectory - The trajectory to follow
      Returns:
      A path following command for the given trajectory

    • followPathGroup

      public edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandBase followPathGroup(List<PathPlannerTrajectory> pathGroup)
      Create a sequential command group that will follow each path in a path group. This will not trigger any events while path following.
      Parameters:
      pathGroup - The path group to follow
      Returns:
      Command for following all paths in the group

    • followPathWithEvents

      public edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandBase followPathWithEvents(PathPlannerTrajectory trajectory)
      Create a path following command that will trigger events as it goes.
      Parameters:
      trajectory - The trajectory to follow
      Returns:
      Command that will follow the trajectory and trigger events

    • followPathGroupWithEvents

      public edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandBase followPathGroupWithEvents(List<PathPlannerTrajectory> pathGroup)
      Create a sequential command group that will follow each path in a path group and trigger events as it goes. This will not run any stop events.
      Parameters:
      pathGroup - The path group to follow
      Returns:
      Command for following all paths in the group

    • resetPose

      public edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandBase resetPose(PathPlannerTrajectory trajectory)
      Create a command that will call the resetPose consumer with the first pose of the path. This is usually only used once at the beginning of auto.
      Parameters:
      trajectory - The trajectory to reset the pose for
      Returns:
      Command that will reset the pose

    • wrappedEventCommand

      protected static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandBase wrappedEventCommand(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command eventCommand)
      Wrap an event command, so it can be added to a command group
      Parameters:
      eventCommand - The event command to wrap
      Returns:
      Wrapped event command

    • getStopEventCommands

      protected edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandBase getStopEventCommands(PathPlannerTrajectory.StopEvent stopEvent)

    • stopEventGroup

      public edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandBase stopEventGroup(PathPlannerTrajectory.StopEvent stopEvent)
      Create a command group to handle all of the commands at a stop event
      Parameters:
      stopEvent - The stop event to create the command group for
      Returns:
      Command group for the stop event

    • fullAuto

      public edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandBase fullAuto(PathPlannerTrajectory trajectory)
      Create a complete autonomous command group. This will reset the robot pose at the begininng of the first path, follow paths, trigger events during path following, and run commands between paths with stop events.

      Using this does have its limitations, but it should be good enough for most teams. However, if you want the auto command to function in a different way, you can create your own class that extends BaseAutoBuilder and override existing builder methods to create the command group however you wish.

      Parameters:
      trajectory - Single trajectory to follow during the auto
      Returns:
      Autonomous command

    • fullAuto

      public edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandBase fullAuto(List<PathPlannerTrajectory> pathGroup)
      Create a complete autonomous command group. This will reset the robot pose at the begininng of the first path, follow paths, trigger events during path following, and run commands between paths with stop events.

      Using this does have its limitations, but it should be good enough for most teams. However, if you want the auto command to function in a different way, you can create your own class that extends BaseAutoBuilder and override existing builder methods to create the command group however you wish.

      Parameters:
      pathGroup - Path group to follow during the auto
      Returns:
      Autonomous command

    • pidControllerFromConstants

      protected static edu.wpi.first.math.controller.PIDController pidControllerFromConstants(PIDConstants constants)
